definition.name: NXmicrostructure_score_config

symbol.name: n_dg_ori
symbol.doc: Number of Bunge-Euler angle triplets for deformed grains.

symbol.name: n_rx_ori
symbol.doc: Number of Bunge-Euler angle triplets for recrystallization nuclei.

symbol.name: n_drag
symbol.doc: Number of support points for the linearized drag profile.

symbol.name: n_temp
symbol.doc: Number of suport points for the desired time-temperature profile.

symbol.name: n_defrag
symbol.doc: Number of entries when to defragment i.e. garbage collect the memory holding state information for recrystallized cells.

symbol.name: n_snapshot
symbol.doc: Number of entries when to collect snapshots of the evolving microstructure.

symbol.name: n_su
symbol.doc: Number of solitary unit domains to export.

definition.doc:
Application definition to configure a simulation with the SCORE model.
* `M. KÃ¼hbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1016/j.actamat.2016.01.068>`_ * `M. Diehl et al. <https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-651X/ab51bd>`_

field.name: simulation_identifier
field.doc: Simulation ID as an alias to refer to this simulation.

field.name: description
field.doc: Discouraged free-text field to add further details to the computation.

group.name: environment
group.doc: Programs and libraries representing the computational environment

group.name: discretization
group.doc: Relevant data to instantiate a starting configuration that is typically a microstructure in deformed conditions where stored (elastic) energy is stored in the form of crystal defects, which in the SCORE model are is considered as mean-field dislocation content.

field.name: extent
field.doc: Extend of each CA domain in voxel along the x, y, and z direction. Deformation of sheet material is assumed. The x axis is assumed pointing along the rolling direction. The y axis is assumed pointing along the transverse direction. The z axis is assumed pointing along the normal direction.

group.name: deformation
group.doc: Details how the deformed grains should be modelled.

field.name: model
field.doc: Which model should be used to generate a starting microstructure.

field.name: extent
field.doc: Extent of each deformed grain in voxel along the x, y, and z direction when type is cuboidal.

field.name: diameter
field.doc: Average spherical diameter when type is poisson_voronoi.

field.name: bunge_euler
field.doc: Set of Bunge-Euler angles ( :math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` ) to sample orientations of deformed grains randomly from.

group.name: ebsd
group.doc: The EBSD dataset from which the initial microstructure is instantiated if model is ebsd.

field.name: stepsize
field.doc: Extent of the pixel of the EBSD orientation mapping assuming square-shaped pixels.

group.name: nucleation
group.doc: Phenomenological model according to which recrystallization nuclei are placed into the domain and assumed growing.

field.name: spatial_distribution
field.doc:
According to which model will the nuclei become distributed spatially:
* csr, complete spatial randomness. * custom, implementation specific. * gb, nuclei placed at grain boundaries

field.name: incubation_time
field.doc: According to which model will the nuclei start to grow.

field.name: orientation
field.doc: According to which model will the nuclei get their orientation assigned.

field.name: bunge_euler
field.doc: Set of Bunge-Euler angles ( :math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` ) to sample orientations of nuclei randomly from.

group.name: material_properties
group.doc: (Mechanical) properties of the material which scale the amount of stored (elastic) energy in the system and thus mainly affect recrystallization kinetics.

field.name: reference_shear_modulus
field.doc: Shear modulus at zero Kelvin.

field.name: reference_burgers_magnitude
field.doc: Magnitude at the Burgers vector at zero Kelvin.

field.name: melting_temperature
field.doc: Melting temperature in degrees Celsius.

group.name: grain_boundary_mobility
group.doc: Model for the assumed mobility of grain boundaries with different disorientation essentially implementing variations of Turnbull's model for thermally-activated migration.

field.name: model
field.doc:
Which type of fundamental model for the grain boundary mobility.
Grain boundaries with disorientation angle smaller than 15 degree are considered as low-angle grain boundaries. Other grain boundaries are high-angle boundaries.

group.name: sebald_gottstein
group.doc: Parameter of the Sebald-Gottstein migration model.

field.name: lagb_to_hagb_cut
field.doc: At which disorientation angle are grain boundary considered as high-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: lagb_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for low-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: lagb_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for low-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: hagb_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for high-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: hagb_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for high-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: special_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for particularly mobile boundaries.

field.name: special_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for particularly mobile boundaries.

group.name: rollett_holm
group.doc: Parameter of the Rollett-Holm migration model.

field.name: m_null
field.doc: The assumed mobility :math:`m_0` of the fastest grain boundary in the system at the assumed temperature. GraGLeS was developed for modelling isothermal annealing.

field.name: c_one
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_1`. Typically 0.99 or higher but not one.

field.name: c_two
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_2`. Typically 5.

field.name: c_three
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_3`. Typically 9.

group.name: stored_energy_recovery
group.doc: Time-dependent reduction of the stored (elastic) energy to account for recovery.

field.name: model
field.doc: Which type of recovery model.

group.name: dispersoid_drag
group.doc: Reduction of the grain boundary migration speed due to the presence of dispersoids through which the total grain boundary area of the recrystallization front can be reduced.

field.name: model
field.doc: Which type of drag model.

group.name: zener_smith
group.doc: Parameter of the Zener-Smith drag model.

field.name: pre_factor
field.doc: Configuration-dependent constant which factorizes the drag pressure.

field.name: surface_energy
field.doc: Average surface energy of the grain-boundary-dispersoid-surface configuration which factorizes the drag pressure.

field.name: time
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of simulated time matching a specific support point of the average dispersoid radius.

field.name: radius
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of the average dispersoid radius.

field.name: time
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of simulated time matching a specific support point of the temperature.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of the temperature.

group.name: simulation_control
group.doc: Criteria which enable to stop the simulation in a controlled manner. Whichever criterion is fulfilled first stops the simulation.

field.name: max_x
field.doc: Maximum recrystallized volume fraction.

field.name: max_time
field.doc: Maximum simulated physical time.

field.name: max_iteration
field.doc: Maximum number of iteration steps.

group.name: numerics
group.doc: Settings relevant for stable numerical integration.

field.name: max_delta_x
field.doc: Maximum fraction equivalent to the migration of the fastest grain boundary in the system how much a cell may be consumed in a single iteration.

field.name: initial_cell_cache
field.doc: Fraction of the total number of cells in the CA which should initially be allocated for offering cells in the recrystallization front.

field.name: realloc_cell_cache
field.doc: By how much more times should the already allocated memory be increased to offer space for storing states of cells in the recrystallization front.

field.name: defragment_cell_cache
field.doc: Should the cache for cells in the recrystallization front be defragmented on-the-fly.

field.name: defragment_x
field.doc: Heuristic recrystallized volume target values at which the cache for cells in the recrystallization front will be defragmented on-the-fly.

field.name: x
field.doc:
List of recrystallized volume target values at which a snapshot of the CA state should be stored.
The code documents summary statistics like recrystallized volume fraction for each iteration. However, snapshots of the microstructure can take much space as SCORE is able to evolve automata with up to :math:`1600^3` cells. Snapshot data document the current microstructure which includes the grain assigned to each of these cells plus the state of the recrystallization front.
Despite these front data make up for approximately one order of magnitude less cells than represented in the domain, more numerical data have to be collected each cell in the front than just a grain identifier.

field.name: apply
field.doc: Perform a statistical analyses of the results as it was proposed by M. KÃ¼hbach (solitary unit model ensemble approach).

field.name: number_of_domains
field.doc: How many independent cellular automaton domains should be instantiated.

field.name: rediscretization
field.doc: Into how many time steps should the real time interval be discretized upon during post-processing the results with the solitary unit modeling approach.

field.name: domain_identifier
field.doc: List of identifier for those domain which should be rendered. Identifier start from 0.
